name: Fireeye ETP
description: Cloud Edition provides RESTful APIs for custom integration. The APIs are provided for Advanced Threats, Email Trace and Quarantine functionalities.

base_url.description: Select the location that your ETP instance resides in

api_key.description: API key for the ETP Instance

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
Callback action for the on_poll ingest functionality.

container_id.description: Container IDs to size the ingestion to.

start_time.description: Start of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)
start_time.verbose: If not specified, the default is past 10 days

end_time.description: End of time range, in epoch time (milliseconds)
end_time.verbose: If not specified, the default is now

container_count.description: Maximum number of container records to query for.

artifact_count.description: Maximum number of artifact records to query for.

actions.description: Get a list of alerts from the ETP instace
actions.verbose:
The email status allows filtering by specific statuses. The valid values for email status are:

  • ACE: Passthrough
  • quarantined
  • released
  • deleted
  • bcc:dropped
  • delivered (retroactive)
  • dropped (oob retroactive)

legacy_id.description: Alert ID as shown in Email Security Web Portal

email_status.description: Filter by ETP email status. Comma seperated list allowed. See app documentation for a list of acceptable values

num_days.description: Number of days to get alerts for (ETP Defaults to last 90 days)

size.description: Number of alerts to retrive per response. Valid range: 1-200 (ETP Defaults to 20)

actions.description: Get a details about a specific alert from the ETP instace

alert_id.description: Alert ID as shown in Email Security Web Portal

actions.description: Get all the attributes from a list of email messages

size.description: Number of alerts to include in response. Valid range: 1-200 (ETP Defaults to 20)

example_values: 250 2.6.0 <97be1b3701c4b71faec8bf7b6.13bf5ad01b.20200614582589.d1f0cfbf6b.ad7426e6@mail.net> [InternalId=23782507632821, Hostname=outlook.com] 89009 bytes in 0.136, 564.397 KB/sec Queued mail for delivery

actions.description: Get the attributes of a particular message with the specified Email Security message ID

etp_message_id.description: The ID of the Email Security message

example_values: 250 2.6.0 <97be1b3701c4b71faec8bf7b6.13bf5ad01b.20200614582589.d1f0cfbf6b.ad7426e6@mail.net> [InternalId=23782507632821, Hostname=outlook.com] 89009 bytes in 0.136, 564.397 KB/sec Queued mail for delivery

actions.description: Search for Email Message by specifying the Queue/Message ID of the Downstream MTA or the Original Message ID. One or the other parameter must be filled out

example_values: 250 2.6.0 <97be1b3701c4b71faec8bf7b6.13bf5ad01b.20200614582589.d1f0cfbf6b.ad7426e6@mail.net> [InternalId=23782507632821, Hostname=outlook.com] 89009 bytes in 0.136, 564.397 KB/sec Queued mail for delivery

size.description: Number of alerts to include in response. Valid range: 1-300 (ETP Defaults to 20)

example_values: 250 2.6.0 <97be1b3701c4b71faec8bf7b6.13bf5ad01b.20200614582589.d1f0cfbf6b.ad7426e6@mail.net> [InternalId=23782507632821, Hostname=outlook.com] 89009 bytes in 0.136, 564.397 KB/sec Queued mail for delivery

250 2.6.0 <97be1b3701c4b71faec8bf7b6.13bf5ad01b.20200614582589.d1f0cfbf6b.ad7426e6@mail.net> [InternalId=23782507632821, Hostname=outlook.com] 89009 bytes in 0.136, 564.397 KB/sec Queued mail for delivery

actions.description: Download the email text and add it to the vault

etp_message_id.description: The ID of the Email Security message to download

actions.description: Downloads all PCAP files of the alert specified by alert ID and adds the files to the vault

alert_id.description: The ID of the Email Security message to download

actions.description: Downloads all malware files of the alert specified by alert ID and adds the files to the vault

alert_id.description: The ID of the Email Security message to download

actions.description: Downloads all case files of the alert specified by alert ID and adds the files to the vault

alert_id.description: The ID of the Email Security message to download

actions.description: Enqueues the message IDs provided in the request for remediation from the user's o365 inbox
actions.verbose:
Note: There is no undo functionality with this action!

The permissions the API account needs to have to use this function are, etp.email_trace.update and etp.email_trace.delete. If the API user does not have these actions you will not be able to use this action.

Any ETP Messages that have a status in this list are ignored and no action will be taken on them.

  • Deleted
  • Dropped
  • Dropped(OOB)
  • Dropped (OOB Retroactive)
  • Rejected
  • Split
  • Permanent Failure

The action_override parameter allows you to override the default action for remedating an email. It is important to note that if you seleted Delete, that it is a permanent delete in Office365.

The move_to parameter allows you to move the identified emails to a specific folder. If the folder is not in the user's mail box, a new custom folder will be created and then the email will be moved into the new folder. Common Office365 folders are

  • junk email
  • junkemail
  • deleted items
  • deleteditems
These folder names are not case sensitive.

etp_message_ids.description: A Comma seperated list of ETP Message IDs

action_override.description: Allows you to override the default action

move_to.description: When 'move' is chosen for action_override, this parameter is mandatory and allows you to specify the folder to move the email to

actions.description: Downloads the email file present in the quarantine for the given Email Security message ID and adds it to the vault

etp_message_id.description: The ID of the Email Security message to download

actions.description: Releases the email file(s) present in the quarantine within ETP

etp_message_id.description: The ID of the Email Security message to download. Allows for a comma seperated string of IDs

is_not_spam.description: Report as not spam to the Spam Engines

headers_only.description: Share only the email headers with Spam Engines

example_values: Invalid etp message ID or the message ID does not exist in quarantine

actions.description: Deletes the email file present in quarantine for the given Email Security message ID

etp_message_id.description: The ID of the Email Security message to download. Allows for a comma seperated string of IDs

actions.description: Get a list of quarantine emails from a given query filter.
actions.verbose: When specifying a date in either the to or from dates, the date is assumed to be in UTC. ETP server runs on UTC time so if you are not converting the timestamp to that time the results will be off.

from_date.description: Start date to use to search the by. Date in YYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.SSSSSS in UTC

to_date.description: End date to use to search by. Date in YYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.SSSSSS in UTC

domains.description: Specific domain(s) to search by. Comma seperated list allowed

email_server.description: Specific email server to search by

from.description: Email address of the sender to search by

reason.description: Reason the email was quarantined. The strings must be of the following reasons, Action, Advanced Threat, Policy, Spam or Virus. Comma seperated list allowed

recipients.description: Recipient(s) to search by. Comma seperated list allowed

sender_domain.description: The senders domain to search by

subject.description: The subject of the email to search by

size.description: Number of alerts to include in response. Valid range: 1-200 (ETP Defaults to 20)

tags.description: Tag associated with email. Must be of the follow tags, auto_remediation, impersonation or manual_remediation. Comma seperated list allowed.
